Question: Canoeing down the Sangamon River, this person ended up in the village of New Salem in Sangamon County.
Hints: Turnout was 82.2 percent, with this person winning the free Northern states, as well as California and Oregon.
In 1832, at age 23, this person and a partner bought a small general store on credit in New Salem, Illinois.
Privately, this person concluded at this point that the slave base of the Confederacy had to be eliminated.
